Sentencas: Doping on the crystal structure is a common strategy to modify electronic conductivity, ion conductivity, and thermal stability.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In this work, a series of transition metal elements (Fe, Co, Cu, Ru, Rh, Pd, Os, Ir, and Pt) doped at the Ni site of La2NiO4+delta compounds as cathode materials of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) are explored based on first-principles calculations, through which the determinant factors for interstitial oxygen formations and migrations are discussed at an atomistic level.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The interstitial oxygen formation and migration energies for doped La2NiO4 are largely reduced in contrast to the pristine La2NiO4+delta, which is explained by charge density distributions, charge density gradients, and Bader charge differences.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In addition, based on a negative correlation between formation energy and migration barrier, the promising cathode materials for SOFCs were screened out between the doped systems.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The Fe-doped structures of x = 0.25, Ru-doped structures of x = 0.25 and x = 0.375, Rh-doped structures of x = 0.50, and Pd-doped structures of x = 0.375 and x = 0.50 are screened out with interstitial oxygen formation energy less than -3 eV and migration barrier less than 1.1 eV.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In addition, DOS analysis indicates that doping to La2NiO4+delta also facilitates the electron conductions.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Our work provides a theoretical guideline for the optimization and design of La2NiO4+delta-based cathode materials by doping.
Titulo: Computational Screening of La2NiO4+δ Cathodes with Ni Site Doping for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
